page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY OF MELKSHAM
page.content: The Bowerhill estate was an RAF camp for training airmen in electronics, arms and the instruments of aeroplanes from 1938 to 1963. The Christie Miller Sports Centre was the old gymnasium in which the men exercised. The left-overs from meals went to the piggery which they had. There was an entrance on the Devizes Road to the camp which now has a barrier across it. There were no proper houses, just rows of wooden huts for the men to live in. They built married quarters at Berryfields for families to live in. The hangers were used for actual training. Until 1938 it was a cookery school and then they built the camp.
